thread.title: AFP offensive continues amid Abu Sayyaf threat to behead German
thread.title_full: AFP offensive continues amid Abu Sayyaf threat to behead German

title: AFP offensive continues amid Abu Sayyaf threat to behead German
text:
AFP offensive continues amid Abu Sayyaf threat to behead German Associated Press / 06:34 PM February 26, 2017 
MANILA, Philippines — The Philippine military says troops are pressing efforts to eradicate Abu Sayyaf militants, who have threatened to behead a German hostage by a ransom deadline that has lapsed. 
Military spokesman Brig. Gen. Restituto Padilla said Sunday that troops were continuing operations to rescue foreign and local hostages, including German hostage Jurgen Gustav Kantner, believed to be held by the militants in the jungles of southern Sulu province. 
Kantner said in a video that circulated online earlier this month that the militants have threatened to behead him by mid-afternoon of Sunday if a ransom were not paid. ADVERTISEMENT 
There was no immediate sign whether the militants pushed through with their threat to kill him. 
President Rodrigo Duterte’s adviser, Jesus Dureza, made a last-minute appeal to the militants to spare Kantner.
